isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WINDSHIELD WASHERS WITH ELECTRIC WIPERS

svcproc.title: WINDSHIELD WASHERS WITH ELECTRIC WIPERS
svcproc.para: The windshield washers have an integral reservoir and electric pump motor located inside the engine compartment ( Figure 108) on the right side cab bulkhead. The windshield washer is activated by the intermittent/washer switch ( Item 1, Figure 103) on the wing panel ( Item 3, Figure 103) of the instrument panel. The washer hoses are mounted on the bulkhead ( Figure 108) after September 1994.
Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

The washer hose (Item 3) is routed from the reservoir-mounted pump (Item 2) across the bulkhead (Item 11) to a T-fitting (Item 8) located on the top middle of the bulkhead. From the T-fitting, the passenger side hose and driver side hose (Items 7 and 9) go to the bulkhead fittings (Item 6) located near each of the wiper pivot assemblies (Item 5), then from the bulkhead fittings to the wiper pivot assembly fitting underneath. From the wiper pivot assembly external fitting (Item 4), the hose goes to the individual nozzles on the wiper arms.
